definition: to act ostentatiously/to brag/to show off
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)

sentences.english: I saw him out posing in his new sports car.
sentences.chinese: 我看見他開着他的嶄新跑車招搖過市。

sentences.english: Because who besides a child can ride a pony?
sentences.chinese: 除了小小孩童，誰還能騎着它“招搖過市”呢？

sentences.english: Whoever poses as a People’s policeman in order to practise fraud shall be given a heavier punishment according to the provisions of the preceding paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 冒充人民警察招搖撞騙的，依照前款的規定從重處罰。

sentences.english: Every day, he swaggers through the street, dressed in cheap and vulgar finery.
sentences.chinese: 他每天穿着廉價而俗氣的華麗衣服，招搖過市。

sentences.english: He often swaggered AND swindled under the guise of the company's name.
sentences.chinese: 他經常假借公司的名義來招搖撞騙。

sentences.english: They flashed it away in their new clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他們穿着新衣服招搖過市。

sentences.english: It's queer that he managed to bluff his way through all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪他居然設法招搖撞騙闖過所有難關。

sentences.english: That's not something that you want to run around saying.
sentences.chinese: 我想你也不想帶着這樣的信號招搖過市。

sentences.english: She is parading the playground in her new dress.
sentences.chinese: 她身穿新衣招搖地在操場上走來走去。

sentences.english: Whoever impersonates a people's policeman to go about and deceive people shall be given a heavier punishment in accordance with the provisions of the preceding paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 冒充人民警察招搖撞騙的，依照前款的規定從重處罰。

sentences.english: He pretended to be a journalist, and swindled lots of money.
sentences.chinese: 冒充記者招搖撞騙，詐取了不少錢財。

sentences.english: In the name of eliminating corruption, he has purged outspoken political rivals.
sentences.chinese: 打着消滅腐敗的名義，他清理了招搖過市的政治敵人。

sentences.english: The budding twigs spread out their fan.
sentences.chinese: 孕育幼芽的枝條伸展着扇子招搖。

sentences.english: She is too ostentatious, unmindful, apropos each other can be manacled without place.
sentences.chinese: 她太招搖，漫不經心，恰好彼此都可以無所束縛。

sentences.english: You can hardly recognize in him the swinger he was thirty years ago .
sentences.chinese: 在他身上你很難看到三十年前他是何等招搖。

sentences.english: I swayed my leaves and flowers in the sun;
sentences.chinese: 陽光中我將葉子與花招搖。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
everything in the garden is lovely
to float about/to flutter (in the breeze)/(dialect) gay guy/(Tw) ghost
thousands of purples and reds (idiom); a blaze of color/fig. a profusion of flourishing trades
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
